title: 108_hr3382
content: The text chunk "SECTION 1. WAIVER OF SOCIAL SECURITY DISABILITY WAITING PERIOD IN THE CASE OF THE TERMINALLY ILL." discusses the waiver of the waiting period for Social Security Disability benefits for terminally ill individuals. The text chunk discusses amendments to the Social Security Act related to Disability Insurance Benefits and Widow's Insurance Benefits based on Disability for terminally ill individuals. It modifies the waiting period requirements for these benefits. The text chunk amends the waiting period requirements for Disability Insurance Benefits and Widow's Insurance Benefits for terminally ill individuals under the Social Security Act. The text chunk amends the waiting period requirements for Disability Insurance Benefits and Widow's Insurance Benefits for terminally ill individuals under the Social Security Act by shortening the waiting period to one calendar month. The text amends the Social Security Act to shorten the waiting period for terminally ill individuals to receive benefits to one month. Terminally ill individuals must have a medical condition that no longer responds to aggressive treatments and is expected to result in death within 12 months. After 12 months, a medical review is required to continue eligibility. The text amends the enrollment period for terminally ill individuals to receive benefits under certain conditions. The amendments made by this Act will be effective for benefits starting on or after January 1, 2004.
